newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash soymeal - Basis steady, trade still slow.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash soymeal - Basis steady, trade still slow.

text.p: Soymeal basis levels were steady with trade slow to pick up after the New Year holiday although dealers said there not been a significant reduction in the crush pace this week.
"I don't think anyone slowed down too much," a dealer said.
Demand for trucks increased slightly at some locations with railcars supplies backed up after the holiday.
Trade in meal was expected to be slow for several days because many consumers had gone heavily long ahead of the Christmas and New Year holidays.

Dealers said news that the Food and Drug Administration had proposed prohibiting using tissues from ruminants in the manufacture of ruminant feeds could be a long-term supportive factor for soybean meal.
"This could be dynamite. Protein commodities such as soymeal will benefit for sure (if the ban takes effect)," one dealer said.
They also noted talk that China had bought about 50,000 tonnes of 44 percent protein U.S. soymeal recently.
